about.summary: Tools to generate unique identifiers and printable barcoded labels for sample management.  The creation of unique ID codes and printable PDF files can be initiated by standard commands,  user prompts, or through a GUI addin for R Studio. Both single-level and hierarchical labels can  be created in the command line interactively or non-interactively.

name: r-barcoder
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "0.1.5" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}
{% set native = 'm2w64-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-barcoder
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/baRcodeR_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/baRcodeR/baRcodeR_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 3cfd7ff3db623f4b6f759bb31ece158e04c42ba54e371a2fc2a3f75dcfe6beb9

build:
  merge_build_host: true  # [win]
  number: 1
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-dt >=0.3
    - r-miniui >=0.1.1
    - r-qrcode
    - r-rstudioapi
    - r-shiny >=0.13
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-dt >=0.3
    - r-miniui >=0.1.1
    - r-qrcode
    - r-rstudioapi
    - r-shiny >=0.13

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('baRcodeR')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('baRcodeR')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://github.com/yihanwu/baRcodeR
  license: GPL-3
  summary: 'Tools to generate unique identifiers and printable barcoded labels for sample management.  The creation of unique ID codes and printable PDF files can
    be initiated by standard commands,  user prompts, or through a GUI addin for R Studio. Both single-level and hierarchical labels can  be created in the command
    line interactively or non-interactively. '
  license_family: GPL3
  license_file: {{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-3

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r

# Package: baRcodeR
# Title: Labelling, Tracking, and Collecting Data from Biological Samples
# Version: 0.1.3
# Authors@R: c(person("Yihan", "Wu", role="aut", email = "yihan.wu@queensu.ca"), person("Robert", "Colautti", email = "robert.colautti@queensu.ca", role = c("aut", "cre")))
# Maintainer: Robert Colautti <robert.colautti@queensu.ca>
# Description: Tools to generate unique identifiers and printable barcoded labels for sample management.  The creation of unique ID codes and printable PDF files can be initiated by standard commands,  user prompts, or through a GUI addin for R Studio. Both single-level and hierarchical labels can  be created in the command line interactively or non-interactively.
# Depends: R (>= 3.4.0), qrcode
# License: GPL-3
# Encoding: UTF-8
# LazyData: true
# Imports: DT (>= 0.3), grDevices, grid, miniUI (>= 0.1.1), shiny (>= 0.13), rstudioapi
# Suggests: testthat, knitr, rmarkdown
# RoxygenNote: 6.1.0
# VignetteBuilder: knitr
# URL: https://github.com/yihanwu/baRcodeR
# BugReports: https://github.com/yihanwu/baRcodeR/issues
# NeedsCompilation: no
# Packaged: 2019-04-26 19:30:38 UTC; colauttilab
# Author: Yihan Wu [aut], Robert Colautti [aut, cre]
# Repository: CRAN
# Date/Publication: 2019-04-26 19:50:03 UTC
smithy_version:
No azure token. Create a token and
put it in ~/.conda-smithy/azure.token
3.7.0
